meanings.definition: A person who is in possession of real property.
meanings.sent1: The seisor of the house was happy to finally own a home.
meanings.sent2: The seisor received the deed to the land after years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The seisor of the farm threw a party to celebrate becoming a landowner.
meanings.sent4: As the seisor of the building, he felt a sense of pride and responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The seisor's ownership of the property was evident in every corner of the estate.

meanings.definition: The act of taking possession of real property.
meanings.sent1: The seisor of the land completed the purchase with a handshake.
meanings.sent2: The seisor of the estate signed the documents to finalize the acquisition.
meanings.sent3: The seisor's claim of the property was met with cheers from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The seisor's acquisition of the house was a significant milestone in his life.
meanings.sent5: The seisor's takeover of the land was smooth and efficient, without any issues.

meanings.definition: The state of being in possession of real property.
meanings.sent1: The seisor of the apartment enjoyed the benefits of property ownership.
meanings.sent2: The seisor's control of the land allowed for development plans to proceed.
meanings.sent3: The seisor's ownership of the house brought a sense of security and stability.
meanings.sent4: The seisor's possession of the property was evident in the well-maintained garden.
meanings.sent5: The seisor's holding of the estate was a source of pride and accomplishment.
